jpen.owner
Class AbstractPenOwner

java.lang.Object
  jpen.owner.AbstractPenOwner
All Implemented Interfaces:
PenOwner
Direct Known Subclasses:
AwtPenOwner
public abstract class AbstractPenOwner
extends java.lang.Object
implements PenOwner

Provides a mechanism to start/stop the drag-out operation.

Nested Class Summary
 
Nested classes/interfaces inherited from interface jpen.owner.PenOwner

penManagerHandle

Constructor Detail

AbstractPenOwner

public AbstractPenOwner()
Method Detail

setPenManagerHandle

public final void setPenManagerHandle(PenOwner.PenManagerHandle penManagerHandle)
Description copied from interface: PenOwner
Called once by the PenManager.PenManager(PenOwner) constructor to allow this PenOwner to access the PenManager through the given PenOwner.PenManagerHandle.

Specified by:
setPenManagerHandle in interface PenOwner

init

protected abstract void init()
Override this method to do initialization. This method is called after the penManagerHandle is set.

isDraggingOut

public final boolean isDraggingOut()
Description copied from interface: PenOwner
Called by the PenManager to avoid sending PLevelEvents to clients when the location is outside the PenClip and this method returns false. The PenManager calls this method holding the PenOwner.PenManagerHandle.getPenSchedulerLock() synchronization lock.

Specified by:
isDraggingOut in interface PenOwner
Returns:
true if this PenOwner is currently in a drag-out operation.

startDraggingOut

protected final boolean startDraggingOut()
Starts a drag-out operation if there are pressed buttons and installs a penListener which automatically stops the drag-out operation when all the buttons are unpressed. This method must be called while holding the PenOwner.PenManagerHandle.getPenSchedulerLock() (See PenOwner.isDraggingOut()).

Returns:
true if a drag-out operation was started or was already in progress.

getPen

protected final Pen getPen()

stopDraggingOut

protected final boolean stopDraggingOut()
Force stopping a drag-out operation if it was in progress. This method must be called when entering the PenClip to stop the drag-out operation if it was still in progress. This method must be called while holding the PenOwner.PenManagerHandle.getPenSchedulerLock() (See PenOwner.isDraggingOut()).

Returns:
true if a drag-out operation was in progress and was stopped.
